item.title: By: 4g63rotary
item.dc:creator: 4g63rotary
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://grandmighty.github.io/grandmighty/2014/07/lsx-parts-overview-vi/#comment-88532">Eric</a>.
Thanks! BTW you move pretty quick with your projects makes for a very inspirational read!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Eric.

Thanks! BTW you move pretty quick with your projects makes for a very inspirational read!

item.title: By: Eric
item.dc:creator: Eric
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://grandmighty.github.io/grandmighty/2014/07/lsx-parts-overview-vi/#comment-87749">4g63rotary</a>.
I would definitely recommend the Pineapple Racing Idler Pulley, it's a very high quality unit. The remainder of the pulleys can be whatever, Greddy etc. all look the same IMO. They're just basic aluminum pulleys. I think Touge Factory offers a set too for a bit cheaper.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to 4g63rotary.

I would definitely recommend the Pineapple Racing Idler Pulley, it’s a very high quality unit. The remainder of the pulleys can be whatever, Greddy etc. all look the same IMO. They’re just basic aluminum pulleys. I think Touge Factory offers a set too for a bit cheaper.

item.title: By: 4g63rotary
item.dc:creator: 4g63rotary
item.description:
I dig the heat shielding, I'm very interested in it and I assume since you've invested in it for the second time that its worth its weight in gold! On another note idler pulleys, I've never really set out to upgrade these kinds of things my self but the motor I picked up for my FD needs a complete set. Are there any that you might recommend?
Wendell-
item.content:encoded:
I dig the heat shielding, I’m very interested in it and I assume since you’ve invested in it for the second time that its worth its weight in gold! On another note idler pulleys, I’ve never really set out to upgrade these kinds of things my self but the motor I picked up for my FD needs a complete set. Are there any that you might recommend?

Wendell-
